Welcome to VisGrid3D’s documentation!¶

Example¶

from VisGrid3D import *

simdir = 'morpheus/simulation_name_10/'
# only show pixels for cells of type 0 and 2
celltypes = [0,2]
# color for each type
colors = [(1,0,0),(0,0,1)]
# alpha (opacity) for each type
alpha = [1,0.1]
# background color
bgcolor = (0,0,0)
# color of bounding box wire frame
bboxcolor = (1,1,1)

# create visualizer
v = Visualizer3D(simdir, bg=bgcolor, bbox_color=bboxcolor)

# start animation
v.animate(celltypes, tau_colors=colors, tau_alpha=alpha, fps=5, static_tau=[2])

Visualizer¶

class VisGrid3D.Visualizer3D(simdir, steps=None, winsize=(800, 800), bg=(0, 0, 0), bbox_color=(1, 1, 1), cam_props=None)[source]¶

Create visualizer object

Parameters:
  • simdir – path to folder containing vtk files
  • steps – steps to visualize
  • winsize – window size
  • bg – background color
  • bbox_color – bounding box wire frame color
  • cam_props – dictionary with camera settings
animate(tau, tau_colors=None, tau_alpha=None, steps=None, save=False, impath=None, imprefix=None, fps=5, static_tau=None)[source]¶

Animate simulation results

Parameters:
  • tau – list of cell types
  • tau_colors – list with color per cell type
  • tau_alpha – list with opacity per cell type
  • steps – steps (all steps are shown when not specified)
  • save – save view to png
  • impath – path to store image
  • imprefix – image prefix
  • fps – frames per second
  • static_tau – static cell types that should not be updated during the animation
get_actors(step, tau_list, tau_colors=None, tau_alpha=None, bbox=True)[source]¶

Create actors for a list of cell types and add them to the renderer

Parameters:
  • step – step to visualize
  • tau_list – list of cell types
  • tau_colors – list with color per cell type
  • tau_alpha – list with opacity per cell type
  • bbox – show bounding box
visualize(step, tau_list, show=False, save=False, impath=None, imprefix=None, bbox=True, tau_alpha=None, tau_colors=None)[source]¶

Visualize a given step.

Parameters:
  • step – step to visualize
  • tau_list – list of cell types
  • show – initialize and start the render window after adding the actors to the renderer, should not be used for animations
  • save – save view to png
  • impath – path to store image
  • imprefix – image prefix
  • bbox – show bounding box
  • tau_alpha – list with opacity per cell type
  • tau_colors – list with color per cell type
